question:
You have received a letter from your university. The University of Cambridge demanding a reason for your absence from an exam. You were ill that day, but failed to submit the evidence. Write a letter to the examinations committee explaning your situation. You should include:
* Applogize for the situation
* Identification for yourself (name, student number, case number)
* An explanation of what had happened and any possible evidence you may have
* Possible resolutions to consider
text: I am writing this letter to you in response to the correspondence which I received from the university demanding a reason for my absence from an exam.

I am a student in a post-graduate diploma course in management. My name is Kuljeet Kaur and my student number is 423xxx. Although I have taken all the exams except the one that is on the 14th of June.

I was unable to submit the evidence at that time, thus, I really apologise for the same. My physical health was not good at that time and the doctor advised me some medical tests which showed that I was suffering from Dengue and needs complete bed rest for at least 15 days. I will produce the certificate given by health experts as a piece of evidence to show my condition.

It will affect my scorecard. Therefore, It would be really commendable if you could permit me to appear in the test next week so that I am able to show my performance otherwise my whole year will be wasted.
Looking forward to hearing a positive and speedy reply from your side.
